shortDesc: Designing, validating and deploying hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) test infrastructure used for firmware validation.
Hardware and software design of control systems used in vehicle validation programs.
fullDesc: My work in hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) development requires electrical design, software setup and on-going support for HIL test fixtures.
I design electrical schematics to simulate in-field conditions and allow fault injection to vehicle control units.
I also develop software tools used by firmware validation engineers to setup regression test cases on the HIL testers.

shortDesc: I am reseaching the development of a micro-sensor for antibiotic detection in milk.
As a teaching assistant I have led seminars, lab activities and occassional lectures.
fullDesc: I work as a researcher in the Applied Optics and Microsystems Laboratory under the supervision of Dr. Christopher Collier. My research is centered on the development of a novel microsensor for detecting antibiotics in milk.
I am working with high voltage electronics, micro-fabrication tools and optical equipment to develop the hardware and software of a microfluidic sensor.
I also work as a teaching assistant where I have led seminars, lab activities and delivered lectures on occasion.

shortDesc: In this role, I built hardware and software solutions for PCBA functional testing.
In 8 months, I designed and commissioned several test fixtures and workflow applications.
fullDesc: As a test engineer at Creation's PCBA manufacturing facility, I built hardware and software solutions for PCBA functional tests.

I worked extensively with OrCAD, LabVIEW and TestStand to design, debug and commission several test fixtures. I tested components not limited to stepper motor drivers, electrochemical sensors, DAC/ADCs and microcontrollers.
I also built applications for workflow automation using LabVIEW and Visual Basic.

shortDesc: I worked with a small team tasked with designing a new ERP system for the municipality.
My contributions were documenting work flow processes, database maintainance and general IT support.
fullDesc: I worked within Toronto Water on their Enterprise Work Management Systems team. My team was responsible for designing and implementing a new ERP system for the municipality.
My main responsibility was to document work flow processes which would be represented in the new ERP system.
Additional contributions included constructing the foundation of an SQL database for tracking assets in a GIS database and general IT support.
